Class MenuService

java.lang.Object
edu.tamu.csce331.sharetea.database.MenuService
public class MenuService extends Object
Service class for managing menu-related database operations in the Sharetea POS system.

This service provides comprehensive CRUD operations for menu items, including retrieval by category, management of active/inactive items, and handling of menu item relationships with other system components.

Key features include:

  • Retrieval of all menu items or filtered by category
  • Soft delete functionality (marking items as inactive)
  • Automatic sequence management for PostgreSQL serial columns
  • Comprehensive error handling and logging
  • Support for menu item customization and pricing

The service handles the menu_items table and provides methods for:

  • Creating new menu items
  • Updating existing menu items
  • Soft deletion (deactivation) of menu items
  • Retrieving menu items by various criteria
  • Managing menu categories
Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • DatabaseConnection

      public MenuService()

  • Method Details

    • getAllMenuItems

      public List<MenuItem> getAllMenuItems()
      Retrieves all menu items from the database, including both active and inactive items.

      This method returns all menu items in the system, regardless of their active status. Items are ordered by category first, then by name for consistent presentation.

      This method is typically used by administrative interfaces where visibility of all items (including deactivated ones) is required for management purposes.

      Returns:
      a List of MenuItem objects containing all menu items in the database, ordered by category and name. Returns an empty list if no items exist or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving only active items
      • for category-specific retrieval

    • getActiveMenuItems

      public List<MenuItem> getActiveMenuItems()
      Retrieves only active menu items from the database.

      This method filters out inactive (soft-deleted) menu items and returns only those that are currently available for ordering. Items are ordered by category first, then by name for consistent presentation.

      This method is typically used by customer-facing interfaces and ordering systems where only available items should be displayed.

      Returns:
      a List of MenuItem objects containing only active menu items, ordered by category and name. Returns an empty list if no active items exist or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving all items including inactive ones
      • for category-specific active items

    • getMenuItemsByCategory

      public List<MenuItem> getMenuItemsByCategory(String category)
      Retrieves active menu items filtered by a specific category.

      This method returns only active menu items that belong to the specified category. Items are ordered by name for consistent presentation within the category.

      This method is useful for:

      • Category-based menu displays
      • Filtering menu items in user interfaces
      • Generating category-specific reports
      Parameters:
      category - the category name to filter by (case-sensitive)
      Returns:
      a List of MenuItem objects containing active menu items in the specified category, ordered by name. Returns an empty list if no items exist in the category or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving all active items
      • for getting available categories

    • getAllCategories

      public List<String> getAllCategories()
      Retrieves all unique categories from active menu items.

      This method returns a list of distinct category names that are currently associated with active menu items. Categories are ordered alphabetically for consistent presentation.

      This method is useful for:

      • Populating category selection lists in user interfaces
      • Generating category-based navigation menus
      • Creating category filters and reports
      Returns:
      a List of String objects containing unique category names from active menu items, ordered alphabetically. Returns an empty list if no categories exist or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for retrieving items in a specific category

    • addMenuItem

      public boolean addMenuItem(MenuItem menuItem)
      Adds a new menu item to the database.

      This method creates a new menu item record in the database with the provided information. The method handles PostgreSQL sequence synchronization to prevent duplicate key errors and ensures proper ID generation.

      The menu item will be created with the following defaults if not specified:

      • active: true (item is immediately available)
      • created_at: current timestamp

      This method will throw a RuntimeException if the database operation fails, which should be handled by the calling code.

      Parameters:
      menuItem - the MenuItem object containing the menu item data to be added. Must not be null and should have valid name, category, and price.
      Returns:
      true if the menu item was successfully added to the database, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a database error occurs during the operation
      See Also:
      • for updating existing items
      • for removing items

    • updateMenuItem

      public boolean updateMenuItem(MenuItem menuItem)
      Updates an existing menu item in the database.

      This method modifies the properties of an existing menu item record based on the provided MenuItem object. The update is performed using the menu item's ID to identify the correct record.

      All fields of the menu item can be updated, including:

      • Name and description
      • Category classification
      • Default price
      • Active status

      This method will throw a RuntimeException if the database operation fails, which should be handled by the calling code.

      Parameters:
      menuItem - the MenuItem object containing the updated data. Must not be null and must have a valid menuItemId.
      Returns:
      true if the menu item was successfully updated in the database, false if no rows were affected (item not found)
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a database error occurs during the operation
      See Also:
      • for creating new items
      • for retrieving items before updating

    • deleteMenuItem

      public boolean deleteMenuItem(Long menuItemId)
      Deletes a menu item from the database using soft delete or hard delete.

      This method attempts to perform a hard delete first by removing the menu item record from the database. If the hard delete fails due to foreign key constraints (e.g., the item is referenced in existing orders), the method automatically falls back to a soft delete by marking the item as inactive.

      The soft delete approach ensures data integrity while still removing the item from active menus. This is particularly important for maintaining historical order data.

      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the unique identifier of the menu item to delete
      Returns:
      true if the menu item was successfully deleted (either hard delete or soft delete), false if the operation failed
      See Also:
      • for modifying items instead of deleting
      • for retrieving items before deletion

    • getMenuItemById

      public MenuItem getMenuItemById(Long menuItemId)
      Retrieves a specific menu item by its unique identifier.

      This method performs a database lookup to find a menu item with the specified ID. The method returns the complete MenuItem object including all its properties, regardless of whether the item is active or inactive.

      This method is useful for:

      • Retrieving item details for editing
      • Validating item existence before operations
      • Displaying detailed item information
      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the unique identifier of the menu item to retrieve
      Returns:
      a MenuItem object if found, null if no item exists with the specified ID or if a database error occurs
      See Also:
      • for retrieving multiple active items
      • for category-based retrieval
